posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Dwarven Battlerager


Image source: https://db4sgowjqfwig.cloudfront.net/ca ... 1511264975

Introduction:
I always tried to imagine what a Dwarven Bard-Barbarian would be like. 

Terrifying and Intimidating. Cursing. Taunting. Resilient and enduring. Good with a Warhammer.

This is the best I could translate such concepts into a build, perhaps it might be another barbarian build I would be prepared to play!

Minimum Goals:
- Bard Song 16+ with Curse Song
- Terrifying Rage
- Weapon Specialization / Epic Weapon Specialization
- Melee base AB 38+
- Max Discipline Taunt
- HP 400+, Heavy Armor Proficiency
- Level 6 Bard Spell book

Build specifications:
- Melee base AB 38, WF/EWF: Warhammer, WS/EWS: Warhammer, Epic Prowess, Blind Fight/Knockdown
- Base 472 HP (Capped at 712 HP), Heavy Armor Proficiency, +8AC from Tumble 40, Damage Reduction 2/-
- Fort 29 (36), Will 19 (26), Reflex 19 (26) - saves against spells in () brackets
- 293 skill points for Discipline, Taunt, Intimidate, Perform, Tumble, UMD, Listen etc...
- Level 6 Bard Spell Book, with Craft Wand (or Still Spell)
- Level 19 Bard/Curse Song (Effective +7AB / +7AC), Lasting Inspiration, Lingering Song
- Terrifying Rage at level 30 with ESF: Intimidate for 56+d10 DC checks, 5 uses / day
- 20% exp penalties at level 17, 19 to 21, 35 to 40.

Expected strengths:
- Parties
- Hitting things (due to WS/EWS, Bard/Curse Song for effective +7AB + Taunt for effective up to +6 AB)
- Tanking things
- Scaring things (due to Curse Song / Terrifying Rage combo)
- Intimidating NPCs to do what you want
- Crafting wands (of Improved Invisibility for example)

Expected weaknesses:
- Arcane spell casters
- Sneakers
- Dev Crit opponents
- Dedicated archers (ie AA)
- Opponents using Taunt against you

Wishlist:
- Earlier Bard 16 (for the -5 AC curse song)
- Earlier Lasting Inspiration
- Earlier Terrifying Rage
- Earlier WS/EWS
- More Strength
- Epic Damage Reduction III
- Still Spell

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
With the new fixes to Sneak, your build is not all that susceptible anymore.

It will take a level 20 sneaker to flank sneak your Barb.  So, there is that.

Looks like a pretty solid build to me!  I really like the Curse song addies!  I have been running a Barb and something like that sure would come in handy!

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
Just how I imagine a Dwarf Skald, but I don't have the knowledge to put that all together.

I really like it and I suspect every Bard build is about compromise. Curse Song rather Still Spell nails this build and gives it a lot of character. I can see the Battlerager battling and cursing at a Dragon, who wishes to claim a Dwarf Hold for its riches...

Thank you for sharing :-)
